trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Gigya | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Gigya | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Gigya with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Gigya with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Gigya.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Gigya.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Gigya single sign on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Gigya single sign on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Gigya will be able to single sign into the application at your Gigya company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Gigya will be able to single sign into the application at your Gigya company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Gigya
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Gigya

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Gigya.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Gigya.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Gigya.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Gigya.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Gigya, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Gigya, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Gigya</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Gigya</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Gigya with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Gigya with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.
trans-unit.target: As part of this procedure, you are required to create a base-64 encoded certificate file.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Gigya application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Gigya application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Gigya page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Gigya page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Gigya Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.gigya.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Gigya Sign On URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.gigya.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Gigya page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Gigya page, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Gigya company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Gigya company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Settings \> SAML Login, and then click the Add button.
trans-unit.target: Go to Settings \> SAML Login, and then click the Add button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Login</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Login</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the SAML Login section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the SAML Login section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Configuration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Sign-On Service URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Single Sign-On Service URL value, and then paste it into the Single Sign-On Service URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Name Identifier Format value, and then paste it into the Name ID Format textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Gigya dialog page, copy the Name Identifier Format value, and then paste it into the Name ID Format textbox.

trans-unit.source: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Create a base-64 encoded file from your downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to convert a binary certificate into a text file</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the X.509 Certificate textbox.
trans-unit.target: Open your base-64 encoded certificate in notepad, copy the content of it into your clipboard, and then paste it to the X.509 Certificate textbox.

trans-unit.source: Click Save Settings.
trans-unit.target: Click Save Settings.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Gigya, they must be provisioned into Gigya.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Gigya, they must be provisioned into Gigya.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Gigya, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Gigya, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Gigya company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Gigya company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Admin \> Manage Users, and then click Invite Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Admin \> Manage Users, and then click Invite Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Manage Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Invite Users dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Invite Users dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Invite Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Invite Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Email textbox, type the email alias of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Email textbox, type the email alias of a valid Azure Active Directory account you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: Click Invite User.
trans-unit.target: Click Invite User.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Active Directory account holder will receive an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Gigya user account creation tools or APIs provided by Gigya to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Gigya user account creation tools or APIs provided by Gigya to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Gigya **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Gigya **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
